alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 5:16PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with strong winds will impact portions of Blaine, Hill and northeastern Chouteau Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 511 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking several thunderstorms developing and tracking northeast at 35 mph across portions of northeast Chouteau, Hill and Blaine counties. Stronger cells were located just northeast of Havre and just north of Fort Belknap. In addition to lightning and rainfall, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph have been observed with these storms along with reduced visibility in blowing dust. Pea size hail is possible with the strongest thunderstorm cells. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Havre, Chinook, Big Sandy, Harlem, Parker School, Beaver Creek, Azure, Agency, St. Pierre, Gildford, Sangrey, Boneau, Fort Belknap, Turner, Box Elder, Hingham, Rocky Boy, Cleveland, Zurich and Hogeland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
